Question: When driving on a road with lanes you must be able to stop in half the length of clear road you can see in front of you.
Can you stop on a bus stop in a private motor vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Only if it is for less than 5 minutes

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
To help you from being blinded by the headlights of an oncoming vehicle, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Look to the left-hand side of the road
Look to the right-hand side of the road
Look to the centre of the road
Turn the headlights of your vehicle onto high beam

Question: What must you do at an intersection controlled by a give way sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
You must not go unless it is safe
Give way to all other vehicles, except those that have stopped at a stop sign

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Which parts of the car must be in good condition to prevent too much noise and gases entering the car?

Answers.Answer: Good mud guards and mud flaps
A good silencer and exhaust system

Question: When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: Who is responsible for making a child under 14 years use a seat belt or a safety seat in a vehicle?
What should you do when you come up to a one-lane bridge?

Answers.Answer: Sound your vehicle horn and drive slowly over the bridge
Turn your vehicle headlights on and drive quickly over the bridge
Slow down and check for any oncoming vehicles before driving on
Drive on and make sure any oncoming vehicles reverse off the bridge

Question: What must you do when red lights are flashing at a railway level crossing?

Answers.Answer: Drive over the lines as soon as the train has passed
Slow down and then drive over the lines
Stop until the lights stop flashing
Stop and if no train is coming you may drive over the lines

Question: What does this marking mean?
What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: What colour is the line painted on a sealed road at a Give Way sign?
At night, a towed vehicle must:

Answers.Answer: have a red light at the back

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: Do not drive faster than 100km/h unless the road is clear
A rest area is 100 metres ahead

Question: When you have a learner licence you do not have to have it with you when you drive if your supervisor has their licence with them.
If you are driving and you want to use a cellphone what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Stop in the flush median to answer calls when it is safe to do so
Answer the call at the next set of traffic signals
Slow down to answer the call when it is safe to do so
Pull over and stop to use the cellphone when it is safe to do so

Question: How close can you park your vehicle to the approach side of a pedestrian crossing where no broken yellow lines have been marked?
Which one of the following vehicles can you drive on a car licence?
What should you do if you are driving and become sleepy?

Answers.Answer: Drive on the far left side of the road
Move off to the left of the road and have a rest
Speed up so that you can get home quickly
Keep on driving but use a lower gear

Question: You wish to make a right turn on a narrow country road. There is a vehicle coming towards you and traffic behind you. What is the safest option?

Answers.Answer: Wait in the centre of the road and turn when it is clear
Drive straight ahead and do a U-turn when the road is clear
Decide not to turn and drive straight ahead
Move to the left side of the road and turn when the road is clear

Question: What is the best way to check for hazards before reversing your vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Relying only on the outside mirrors
Turning to look over your shoulders
Relying only on the inside mirrors
Walking around the vehicle before reversing

You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?

Answers.Answer: You can judge your speed more easily
Your driving reactions will be quicker

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow
